text: Gardenia remyi, the nānū or Remy's gardenia, is a species of flowering tree in the madder family, Rubiaceae. It is endemic to Hawaii. It inhabits coastal mesic, mixed mesic, and wet forests at elevations of on Kauai, Molokai, Maui, and the Big Island. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== remyi Category:Endemic flora of Hawaii Category:Trees of Hawaii Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Gardenia remyi
